pullRequest.title: [GEOS-9526] review extension license information
pullRequest.bodyText:
Working on a couple of glitches:

 maven assembly file inclusion sensitive to location of mvn -f src/pom.xml
 upgrade to maven assembly plugin 3.2.0 to use of mvn assembly:single -N
 review extension licenses
 Avoid multiple files called LICENSE.txt by changing to GPL.md and LGPL.md as needed
 use markdown licenses where available
 distinguish between license NOTICE.md (describing how licenses are used) and the licenses themselves

See GEOS-9526 for detailed discussion.
Checklist
For all pull requests:

 Confirm you have read the contribution guidelines
 You have sent a Contribution Licence Agreement (CLA) as necessary (not required for small changes, e.g., fixing typos in documentation)
 Make sure the first PR targets the master branch, eventual backports will be managed later. This can be ignored if the PR is fixing an issue that only happens in a specific branch, but not in newer ones.

The following are required only for core and extension modules (they are welcomed, but not required, for community modules):

 There is a ticket in Jira GEOS-9526
 PR for bug fixes and small new features are presented as a single commit
 Commit message must be in the form "[GEOS-XYZW] Title of the Jira ticket" (export to XML in Jira generates the message in this exact form)
 The pull request contains changes related to a single objective. If multiple focuses cannot be avoided, each one is in its own commit and has a separate ticket describing it.
 This PR passes all existing unit tests (test results will be reported by travis-ci after opening this PR)
 This PR passes the QA checks (QA checks results will be reported by travis-ci after opening this PR)

Submitting the PR does not require you to check all items, but by the time it gets merged, they should be either satisfied or inapplicable.

commit.message:
[GEOS-9526] Run assembly attached from root folder

requried for consistent function between build_release and jenkens build server due to a known isse with the maven assembly plugin.

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

[GEOS-9526] extension contents cleanup

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

upgrade to maven-assembly-plugin 3.2.0

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

fix travis build to assembly:single

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: The pushd src a few lines above means you don't need -f src/pom.xml (more specifically, as written the build will fail - remove -f src/pom.xml )
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -294,8 +294,7 @@ else
    echo "Skipping mvn clean install -P communityRelease -DskipTests"
 fi
 
-
-mvn assembly:attached $MAVEN_FLAGS
+mvn -f src/pom.xml assembly:single $MAVEN_FLAGS -N

nodes.bodyText: I see this was deleted, but didn't see a replacement. Any reason why there was no replacement?
